name: Premier Inn London Putney Bridge

reviews.text: The outside looks like a 70's office block, but don't be put off. Inside the staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room was basic but large and clean. The location was perfect for us going to Wimbledon - 2 minute walk to the tube and 2 tube stops to Wimbledon. Breakfast was good and the staff were very helpful. Also, convenient for central London - only 20 mins on the tube. We'll stay here again.
reviews.title: Don't be put off by the outside

reviews.text: We booked a Premier Inn as we are a family of 3 and we know what to expect. Decent sized room and free breakfast for my 14 yr old. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Not pretty from the outside but fine inside. We were concerned about noise from the busy road outside but our sleep wasn't disturbed in the 3 nights we stayed. Round the corner from Putney bridge tube station and plenty of restaurants and bars nearby to choose from
reviews.title: Typical premier inn hotel

reviews.text: This hotel looks like a dump from the outside but is actually a very nice and clean hotel. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. What really annoyed me was the day manager who was a complete officious, arrogant, unyielding twit. We booked a family room which by some arbitrary standard is 2 adults and 2 children (Under 16). At check in we were told we had to book another room as one of our children was 18 years old. There was no argument that was the rule. We booked another room for our child at 175 pounds for two nights. We got to our family room and it was huge with ample room for our family. I was not happy. Our daughter had to stay in a room by herself and it was not an adjoining room, but at least was on the same floor.
reviews.title: Rude day manager

reviews.text: The hotel looks like a 70's office block but the interior is typical Premier Inn Purple. Clean and uncomplicated. My room was huge and modern. I paid £265 for three nights bed and breakfast (extra). Staff friendly enough.
reviews.title: The hotel is fine. Clean and handy for the tube,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights. There is a pub in the hotel but I prefer a real pub. There is one nearby called the 8 Bells I think which was very ordinary but convenient. Over the bridge there are some better pubs.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Great value, convenient location. As others have said, this hotel is relatively inexpensive (for London) and very close to the Putney Bridge stop on the tube. The line you pick up from there can take you right to the Winchester Abbey location, as well as on to the London Bridge.
reviews.title: Great value and location - friendly staff, quiet, and good breakfast

reviews.text: Breakfast was a fantastic deal, especially since both of our kids (ages 9 and 13) ate for free. Cereals and fruit, fried eggs and sausages, muffins and croissants - they had all the basics for a filling meal at a very reasonable cost.
reviews.title: Great family hotel near London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very quiet, although we took the precaution of asking for something high, off the road, and away from the elevator (lift). But very quiet.
reviews.title: Avoid - overpriced and low quality

reviews.text: The room itself was nice. We got a family room, which comes with a "double" bed and two cots for the kids. Bed size can be confusing, since Double sometimes just means "bigger than a single". In this case, the bed was an American Queen (which I think is a European King), bigger than an actual double but smaller than an American King (which I think is a European Queen). One of the "cots" was a full size mattress on the floor, but it was a thick mattress/box spring which our 9 nine year was fine with. I think I would have been fine with that too, after walking London all day.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for the City.

reviews.text: The room was a tad warm to my taste, but it does have air conditioning to help. It was also August, of course, and overall it was fine.
reviews.title: Our family loved this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights at the end of December 2010. Our family room was spotlessly clean, spacious enough for a family of 4 and very quiet, since our room looked out the back and away from the main road. Breakfast in the morning was good value ( the kids ate free) and very convenient before heading into London from the Putney Bridge tube station just down the street. With the use of our 7-Day Travelcards, any part of London was easily accessible within minutes, and we really appreciated coming back to our cosy bedroom each night. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurant , as it was more convenient for us to dine in central London, but it looked pleasant . Putney high street , just over the bridge, also has lots of options for eating out if you need them, including a branch of Wagamama.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: Apart from the comfort of the room, the best thing about this hotel is the friendliness and dedication of ALL of the staff there. We were greeted every day with a cheerful 'hello' from every staff member without exception, and I can really say that the people who work in this hotel really go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Clean, good location but beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely time, and would not hesitate to book there again the next time we are in London, !
reviews.title: Nice and clean no frills

reviews.text: I had read reviews of this Premier Inn and we booked on that basis. In the main we weren't let down. It does look ugly from the outside but it was in a good location, just a short walk away from the tube station and with many buses taking you straight into Central London.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with a very good view on the river

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were good - extremely clean and my sister had a family room which was really spacious. Booking in was good, our room was changed easily as I wanted a room away from the lift. The guy on reception (called Hiron, I think) was really nice, very polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Opposite of Premier....terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel as we were attending a wedding reception 10 mins walk away. Location was very good both to Putney/Fulham & close by to transport links to other parts of London.
reviews.title: It Did the Job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were OK, clean enough. Bathroom could do with being updated but thats about it. Staff in reception were very fiendly & helpful.
reviews.title: everything you need

reviews.text: Parking is £18.00 for 24 hours which is quite expensive but typical for London.
reviews.title: Quite a let down.

reviews.text: I would stay here again but only for convenience not for a romantic break!!
reviews.title: Great Value For Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was light and big enough, with a wonderful bed and a nice bathroom; it had everything we wanted and to a fair price. Not far from central London either. Worth the money!
reviews.title: Decent Hotel in London

aka: Premier Inn London Putney Bridge Hotel
